abstract.text: Returns an authorization object initialized with the specified flags, rights and environment.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A bit mask for specifying authorization options. Use the following option sets:
mask to request rights. You can also specify the
masks to request partial rights. You can also specify the
mask to prevent the Security framework from preserving the rights obtained during this call.
A pointer to a set of authorization rights you create. Pass
if the application requires no rights at this time.

Data used when authorizing or preauthorizing rights. In macOS 10.3 and later, you can pass icon or prompt data to be used in the authentication dialog box. Possible values for this parameter are listed in
. The data passed in this parameter is not stored in the authorization reference; it is used only during authorization. If you are not passing any data in this parameter, pass the constant
Normally, such initialization is not required, as you pass in flags, rights, and environmental data when you request authorization.

abstract.text: A flag that instructs the Security Server to revoke authorization.
A flag that permits the Security Server to attempt to grant the rights requested.
A flag that permits user interaction as needed.
An empty flag set that you use as a placeholder when you don’t want any of the other flags.
A flag that permits the Security Server to grant rights on an individual basis.
A flag that instructs the Security Server to preauthorize the rights requested.
A constant you use in functions with an environment parameter if you have no environment data to provide.
Restrict a user’s access to particular features in your Mac app or daemon.
A class that allows you to restrict a user’s access to particular features in your Mac app or daemon.
Returns an authorization object initialized with a default environment, flags, and rights.
Returns an authorization object initialized with the specified flags, rights and environment.
Initializes an authorization object with default environment, flags, and rights.
Initializes an authorization object with the specified flags, rights, and environment.
The flags used to specify authorization options.
An authorization item set designated to hold environment information relevant to authorization decisions.
An authorization item set designated to represent a set of rights.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.

seeAlsoSections.title: Allocating and initializing an authorization object
